scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Kate Woods Walker
scrape.text: It's not so much the Dutch version of Gone Girl as it is a Dutch look at what might happen to the family from Gone Girl in another, slightly different, incarnation.Close readers won't be shocked by the sudden mid-book turn, and American audiences might be puzzled by the European sensibility (we're a hardened and torture-loving people).But for those who love psychological thrillers, this book provides a fine way to spend an afternoon or two. It's a quick read, with, believe it or not, some funny bits. (The narrator's misplaced reticience and delicate sensibilities about what he does and does not reveal are a hoot.)Book clubs might want to chew on the nature vs. nurture implications. I wish the author had grounded a particular plot point about amniocentesis with more actual peer-reviewed science.
